attributes.action: if there's a second vote for the eu, it should extend to general elections also
attributes.background: if the government decide on a second brexit vote like remainers are screaming for, then come every general election in the future regardless of who wins we should get a second electorial vote!

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the UK Government or Parliament to do. Under the Fixed Term Parliaments Act 2011, general elections take place at least every five years. We're not sure what else you'd like to happen. There will be a general election whether or not there is a second referendum. 

You can find out more about the Fixed Term Parliaments Act here:

https://researchbriefings.parliament.uk/ResearchBriefing/Summary/SN06111

You might like to sign and share this petition instead:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/241418
